transcript.content: Doves. 'Caught By The River' on Xfm 104.9. I’m Ricky Gervais... Steve Merchant... Karl Pilkington and everything…
No...I'm gonna be honest with you...
Little bit hungover, don't feel very well. I don't know if I'm hungover or still a bit drunk, but I don't feel->
You sound like you're still a bit drunk.
Yeah. So what I'm worried about-
Then you do every week, so...
What I'm worried about is... that the standard will slip.
Yeah? I'm not right on the ball, urm and, the other thing is I haven't had a lot of time to prepare the show today.
So I don't... And I - and, I don't really... I don't feel...you know.
Yep. I haven't done any... Karl...

I... don't make me laugh because it- it hurts as well. And the other- the other- there's another side effect to me being a little bit hungover, and um drunk or whatever, right, is that I can be annoying.
'Cos I just to amuse myself I sort of like turn my body off a little bit and just poke, and like-
Like that, and annoy people and that... I wanna- I wanna sort of like cl-
Well you do the physical equivalent of freewheeling.
Yeah, yeah! I sort of like, I sort of wanna climb on Karl and go to sleep on him.
Do you know what I mean? Both annoy him, and it'd be comfortable.
Which is... you know, can be annoying.

Do you know, just a quick little thing to make this show a bit easier; if you'd put your hand up when you want one of us to speak... Cos it's not quite- I'm not quite sure when the sentences are finished.
Ok, good, all right. Are you just going to keep them up for the rest of the show, or are-
No that'll ache, Karl, do what you, what you've... Uh?
Good, alright. Do you wanna- Is there any excuse as to why you're a bit hungover?
Yep. Good, good. 'Cos this is the only- I mean this is the only work you've got to do all week-
-unless I'm very much mistaken, you don't have to do anything. You just sit at home eating- eating cheese-
-um, and then occasionally you do a bit of um, sort of shadow boxing-.
-And that's exersise... And then you sit at home and watch TV.
Is that roughly what you did this week?
Uh-huh. So this is... the only two hours you've had to do anything for all week, this is the only thing you had to prepare for...
Yes, I... Who can plan a hangover?
You know, you'd think th- Karl, you said you had some stuff.
I love the fact that whereas I was a little bit slow, Karl there leapt into action, to keep this show afloat, keep the pace up! Go on.
Karl, are you hungover as well or .
Do you know, I'm just a bit annoyed, 'cos I'm with you.
Do y' know what I mean?
He hasn't got much to do all week...
What angers me is I kind of hoped that maybe I could have quite a long career in radio, and I sort of feel like I'm... I don't know, the words 'sinking ship'-
'Cos if you... Karl, you're just a chancer anyway, you weren't even supposed to be on air and we made you into something of a household name and that's cool.

And Ricky's already a celebrity, he's got it stitched up, he's got coroporates, he's got you know, voiceover work, but I've got nothing, I'm running on empty I've got... You know, I'm not... nothing, I've got nothing, I'm sort of dependent a bit on this, financially and...
And...you two are sort of bringing it down really.
Do you reckon I could get my own show, Karl?
Karl, Karl, Karl. Tell him what, no, Karl, Karl, tell him how funny I was out there with the bin, that... a minute ago.
Tell you what. Will we tease them with what we've got coming up next.
Yep, Karl, tease us after the next record.
'Cos I think we've already got 'em for two hours.
Yep, yep, we've hooked them Karl, don't worry, this is textbook radio.
Badly Drawn Boy - You Were Right
Badly Drawn Boy, you were right, Xfm 104.9 Ricky Gervais, Stephen Merchant, Karl Pilkington. Karl you were saying, what's coming up.
Right, over the next 2 hours then... last week was a bit of a mess...
... So I sorted it out. Same features, uhhhh...
I think that was the reason it was a mess to be honest.
You tightened it, you tightened it, you tightened the ship.
Tightened it up, tightened it up, and also, keeping people for longer.
Right, tell me your, tell me your plans, tell me your ethos, then.
What've you come up with then? Always show your workings, Karl.
Alright then. So last week we started a good sort of play on words we had going...
The well known film Educating Rita.
That's become, thanks to Karl Pilkington's brain, it's become..
I've..I've tweaked it a bit and now it's educating ricky
Right. And that was a new feature we started last week if you weren't listening. Where I teach ricky stuff.
Uh, I taught you about that little Chinese hairy kid.
Yeah, you didn't teach me anything. You said there was a kid that was born a little slightly hairier than other Chinese people.
I taught you where the saying "Chewing the Fat" came from.
I enjoyed that. That was good.
That was good, that was interesting.
And a man who had a beard 'cause he had been abducted for 3 days.
That taught me more about you than about alien abduction.
..uh we sort of talked about it all in one go and you can't...
Where as this week you've done what, you've spread it out over the chat
Well I've spread it across the two hours...
...'cause I've always found that if you're trying to be taught to much in one go you just can't take it in and it will be wasted.
Is that your experience at school?
They taught you in three minute bursts-
Yeah and not every day...every other month.
Yeah when you felt like it.
Right so that's what we're gonna do, right? Uhh...
So we've got Educating Ricky coming up that's exciting stuff.
Educating Ricky across the two hours.
And what I do is... I've made little headlines again and you decide which story you wanna know first.
All of 'em. Right give me the first headline.
No no no, not yet. We'll do that in a bit-
Hang on a minute I'm telling you what else.
We've also got...we've also got, we started it last week...Rock-Rockbusters.
Oh yeah that was a triumph.
I think we went wrong there...
Okay so what's the rules on Rockbusters?
We're gonna do Rockbusters but you e-mail in [email protected] when you know the answers, right? And sort of round near the end of the show we'll give out the answers so they've got to hang about.
Rick, I should tell you now umm don't-
Don't think that the listeners are going to go away empty handed...
I was worried about that, I was worried about that.
I can tell you, don't worry, because Karl has sorted out some top quality prizes.
This is stuff that people can win, pretty excited about this, first up is a DVD of The Office.
I don't know how he got hold of it cause they are like gold dust.

This is uhm, this is the second gift now bear in mind he's - I don't know where he's rummaging these from...this is an XFM compilation album. He's managed to sort that out somehow, I don't know how he's managed to sort that out.
There's another compilation album which is got some sort of indie type hits of-
Haven't we got a film to give away?
Well I'm glad you asked cause -
I know you're a big fan of DVD's.
It's one of the big hot releases that everyones getting their hands on...
Yeah...Arbritary is it? This film title won't be an arbritary film will it'll be a big-

Rick, I don't want you thinking that the film that Karl has sorted out, that he sourced for us is some arbritary thing that you wouldn't get, you could buy for 3.99 in HMV. Right, they're giving these away...
Yeah. Like in one of those big baskets...
Exactly. I don't know who is phoning up to try and win this but you can be, uh, a lucky winner.
If this is your favourite film - it's yours.
Exactly. But yeah this is uhm, this is the big uhm star prize, the one you're all playing for...
Stephen King's, 'Children of the Corn' it's a widescreen- widescreen presenation on DVD.
Imagine getting that and going "Excellent, we can watch this now!"
But Rick, I mean let me just run through some of the cast... Peter Horton.
Peter Hortons in it. And eh.. that uh..
I'll tell you what, I don't want to give it away if Hort in it.
I'd love to see his performance again.
Also Linda Hamilton I know you're all familar with her.
Linda Hamilton, she plays, she plays a piece of corn.
Exactly. I've not seen Children of the Corn I could be wrong but uhm it says uhh it's amazing.
Karl, when you were rooting around in the office why didn't you start throwing like a mousemat and a pair of scissors and a pencil because that is just abirtary that.
But also I should say we also have some, this is a bit more exciting, we've also got some tickets for DJ Shadow who is performing at the Brixton Academy this evening.
Yeah. He's good ain't he? He's good at DJ ing.
He's very good at DJ ing.
Plays all the records that you want.
Don't-don't-don't bring your own he's got them all. I've seen him arrive he's got two big bags on 'im.
Yep. So there's uh three pairs of DJ Shadow tickets we'll give those away later just don't start phoning arbritarily we'll give them away in our own spare time-
Okay well while we sort of some lemonade let's play a tune.
Ryan Adams from his new album 'Demolition'.
Yeah. I just [incomprehensible] found a new way of making it more exciting, when you're talking about summet I'll go "Yeah, brilliant" agreeing with ya, making it all interesting!
Well it's a really good album that. Apparently it's just a collection of songs and demos he's had lying around.
Aw...I wish I had that. You know we're giving away those DVD's and Children of the Corn?
Look forward to that, Children of the Corn!
I've got an interesting anecdote about The Office. Karl, me and Karl went out right and uh, me and Jane and Karl and Johnny and Jiji wasn't it?
No, no. No. Jiji wasn't there.
Is it important who was there?
No. But we're walking down the street and, Karl was there he can back me up on this, we had a curry we were walking back and uh this funny little homeless fella, didn't he?
He uh- oh I've got to tell you first before I go "didn't he?"

He came up to me right and he recognized me,[laughs and stammers] talking is more diffcult than you think right, he came up to me and he went "Aw, I've just nicked one of your DVD's from HMV!" and he shook my hand. He was so happy with it and I went "Right. Excellent." and he went "All I do is just swing the bag over the top like that when I'm going out" and he had a bag of DVD's didn't he and he was so pleased to tell me that he'd stolen...isn't that great?
He said they're going like - Of course they are!
We get paid for them though, don't we?
No! What do you mean? Did you sign them for him?
I bet you would you idiot! So uhm, he just nicked five... and you say he's homeless was he?
Well I don't know he, maybe...
Surely how would he have seen the show? He just walked past Currys one morning
Saw the trailer for it, thought "Interesting".
Don't know if he was homeless. Didn't go into his home life.
Sure. You shook his hand though and...
He made Karl look smart. Do you know what I mean? So uh... but he wasn't northern though was he?
No he was like...uh, do you know in the fast show Paul Whitehouse that character, that shady character?
Like that, the spit of that. Ponytail, t-shirt on a bit too big for him, and just the movement and everything like uh, y'know a Cockney little cheeky chap type person.
Yeah he just said "Aw, it's you!" said uh "Got your DVD's, got six of 'em from HMV going like hotcakes they are!" then he went off whistlin'. Well chuffed with himself.

Yeah. What's he gonna do with them then? Probably sell 'em. How does he sell them?! Where does he sell them? Does he go up to people and ask "do you want The Office DVD? They're not nicked. Four quid".
"No no no no no no" "They've still got the tags on 'em".
Well it's like those people who uhm, you know those cab drivers who you meet at sort of three in the morning who just got a car and just went out with a car.
And just went "yeah I'll pick people up and charge 'em".

I got in one once and I said to him eh, the guy just pulled up and I was in east London going back to north London, I said uh "Going back to Swiss Cottage". He went "Sure, hop in!" We set off, he went "Do you know the way?"

I said "Not really no, I thought you know you're a cabbie aren't you? He went "No, don't really know the way there". I said "Do you have an A-Z?" He went "No". I thought if you're gonna go out, you know, just winging it take two things: a map and a torch. He didn't have either.

He said "Uh, well I can probably get to Camden". I said "Alright, I'll direct you from there". Drove on for about five minutes making conversation. About five minutes later he went "Do you know the way to Camden?"
"I thought you knew the way to Camden!" "I don't really know the way, I thought I knew" It was ludicr-!
Oooh let me out. Four quid.
Yeah, exactly. I don't know who's got sort of that time on their hands that they just think "It's three in the morning. I'm at a loose end. I think I'll go out and do a bit of cabbing".
Because your dad was a cabbie wasn't he?
Yeah he was yeah. Couldn't stand it but it was good money.
But he was profess-he wasn't like a chancer though was he?
What was he- what was he doing when he put the little forrest gump in a wheelie bin?
That was uh, part of the cab company thing. They had to do a charity event once a year and he did it one year...never asked him again.
Tell us the story again. I know you already-
I'd rather not because uh, we got a few sort of uh, got some complaints about it.
Why? Why'd you get complaints about it?
Because he put a kid in a bin and it's not the thing to do.
But we could use it as a sort of sobering lesson to people.
Yeah, tell it like uh tell it like you know, you shouldn't do it.

Nah that's how I did it last time but people still didn't like it. All the stuff I tell ya, you know, I don't take the mickey out ofpeople on purpose it's real life innit and that goes on in life. I was saying that in hospital though, you know he was in hospital and he did some jokes about old people an' that and he said "At the end of the day, if something makes you laugh it's funny. And if it makes you laugh, you can't help laughing. You know what I mean? So... what are you meant to do?
And laughing is good for ya so..
Well being laughed at isn't as good for you is it?
No, but there's probably more people laughing at one person so if you balance it out there's only one person who's upset and one person who's laughing. So it's-
That's genius! Give me and example of that, give me an example.
Well for example, Karl Pilkington talking and the people listening.
Yeah, yeah... no. C'mon give me an little example of.... y'know.

Well I can't because again, that's what I'm saying, I can't tell you the story because there might be someone out there who... this person might be listening  and think "I forgot about that and you've brought it all back to me now".
So I'd prefer to leave it but I think people know that-
Why'd he put him in the bin in the first place?
Because he was getting out of hand.
You see I can't explain without-
I'd prefer to leave it honestly.
What was he doing, annoying him?
He was annoying me dad and the other people in the cab.
And he thought "How can I deal with this before it gets too out of hand?"
He pulled over... and put the lad... in a wheelie bin.
Yeah. Yeah. How old was the kid?
Ehm... not sure but it was a trip to sort of Blackpool so I'm guessing...
Did he think it was one of the rides? "This is rubbish!"
Oh, so he was quite an old lad then.
He picked him up and put him in a wheelie bin.
Everytime he says it I can't...
And then on the way back he got him back again and said "Right, you won't do that again".
Yeah he left him there for a bit.
He left him there, what, they went to Blackpool and left the kid in a wheelie bin?
What, was the kid in the wheelie bin on the way back? Did he not get out?
Yeah... no, it's tricky innit and he wasn't a normal kid was he and - let's leave it...
Can I put a song on?

Feeder. 'Come Back Around'. XFM 104.9. Ricky Gervais, Stephen Merchant, Karl Pilkington. I asked Karl in the week, right, what animal would he never trust. Even if he got to know it as a pet and everything, what animal would he NEVER trust. What was it.
Why wouldn't you trust a wasp, Karl?
...all, all other animals, if you get 'em at an early age...
...you can, sort of, make 'em like ya, an' that.
You could train ‘em, and that, yeah.
Is there anything, do you think there’s anything you could do that would, kind of, er, win the favour and win the trust of a wasp? What would you have to do, do you think?
What if you had it from a little grub.
And you fed it, an’ he had its favourite marmalade.
It doesn’t affect it though, does it. A bee dies, don’t it, if it does it, so it’s not gonna, like, use it willynillily.
That’s easy for you to say!
Do you, what, you think they sting arbitrarily? They just sting for the fun of it? They’re like, sort of, like delinquent insects, a delinquent....
I think so, cos last night, right, and this is part of ‘Educating Ricky’ in a way, but something I learnt lastnight…
…was that tarantulas only bite ya if you annoy it.
They don’t, d’you know how people say ohh if you’re in a sleeping bag living in a jungle a spider will get in there and it’ll bite ya.
Apparently not, you’ve got to really annoy it. The thing it really hates is having its leg, sort of, twisted.
It hates having its leg twisted. Right.
Yeah, but that, but that’s more for….
Is that what they said in the documentary?
Almost certainly not, Steve! Almost certainly not.
And, erm, it was this guy….
And was it scrawled on the wall in like a public toilet?
No, I tell ya, I’ll tell ya more about that later as it’s part of the…thing.
Oh right, I’m looking forward to it.
So, if you don’t trust the evil wasp, what animal do you trust, what’s your favourite animal?

Well, I, I also…I said to him, right, supposing you – your mind, right, your mind was put into any animal, right, and you gotta get from where you are now, right, to Glasgow, right, as an animal, right? But the authorities will be looking out for it.
And it’s shooting you, right, and er – what – w – you went through loads didn’t ya?
I was thinking about it for, for, it must have took me about an hour.
So your mind, sorry, your mind has been put into an animal?
And he - yeah, so it’s you in this animal thinking that you’ve got to get to somewhere, but maybe…
But…but the authorities know you’re in the animal?
Yeah, but maybe your body is in Glasgow or summit, and you’ve gotta get this animal to get to you so it can transfer its mind back into your body.
But the Government knows that I’m like this.
Oh, we’ve all had that conversation.
So the Government…so the Government are going ‘Karl can’t have his own brain back’….
I only have it with Karl, don’t I, these conversations?
So think about it just for a second, so, let’s recap.
He’s the only one who takes my questions seriously!
Your - your brain is in London…
Right, and there’s like loads of security and stuff looking out in the sky for animals or looking on – on the fields seeing what’s trying, what’s looking a bit suspicious.
Trying – trying to get to your body and proper brain…
…and they’re shooting everything and killing all the animals. What thing would you pick to get your brain to Scotland that wouldn’t get caught and I reckon I…I – I’ve got the answer.
No, ‘cos think about it, a lot of people get irritated. If it, sort of, wanted to get a lift….
,,,in a car going down the motorway, someone’s driving, there’s a wasp in the car…
So think of something that people wouldn’t, y’know….
And the clock’s ticking as well, yeah.
You’re taking this really very seriously aren’t you Karl.
Yeah, you’ve only got a couple of…
You have, you’ve given this a lot of thought haven’t you. You have.
Is that the sort of thing you’re, you’re…that’s what you’re going for…yeah?
Um…and, is it a c – is it a creature that’s, er, that’s native to this country?
I’ve got no idea Karl. What you thinking.
Think about it. Erm, right, this flea it’s got my brain.
And it’s, it goes “Right, I’ve got to get to Scotland.” So it jumps on someone who’s going to Euston station…
Can’t see it! Steve! Think of that statement!
Think of people who’ve just tuned in!

People get on the train, goes to Glasgow or Edinburgh or wherever in Scotland it is, it jumps off, goes “Right,” er, jumps on someone else who’s going the way it needs to go. Gets there, still no-one’s seeing it, jumps on me, I get me brain back…
But, and you feel confident that your brain would fit in that of a flea’s?
Well, you said there was no problem with the size of it. You said you could….
You – I pretty much, you could download everything you know into a flea.
What would you rather have, right. Roller-skate feet, and there’s little wheels, right. Er…chopstick hands, yeah?
Instead of hands, chopsticks instead of hands. Wheels instead of feet.
Can I take you guys back to the old school? Do you mind if we take – take it back to the old school?
Yeah, what you gonna do, what you gonna lay on me?
No I was just, maybe a bit of, ah, De La Soul, if that’s not a problem?
Is that a problem? Is that a problem going back to the old school? I…I’m not..
I mean we don’t need to go if you don’t want…
As long…as long as it’s vinyl shit.
It is indeed! Slam it on.
De La Soul – A Jam Named Saturday
Yeah, good stuff. Karl. So, erm, ‘Educating Ricky’. You were going to tease us now with some of the big headlines you’ve got coming up.
Look at him grooving. He really is in the groove there.
What would you rather be Karl…

Yeah, that you could leap, you could leap onto a house, but you had to go, for, you had to go BLERRRPH first and leap onto a house. You’re, you’re known as Frog Boy. Right? And, and that, and that could come in useful couldn’t it, right, yeah?

Erm, Amploid, where you’ve got your hands are microphones and you can talk into your hands and your whole body, you can, is like a hundred decibels, and you can go “OI. COME ‘ERE!” and people can hear you from miles away. Amploid, right.
Or...or…Saddo. Right, and that means that you can go up to anyone and go “Alright?” and they just, they don’t know why, they just get fed up for a whole day.
Which of those would you prefer?
Don’t answer now, have a think about it!
The frog thing, do I look like one or…

No, you’re just you in your Ben Sherman shirt and everything, and they go, and people walk along and they go, “Oh look at that young child, from, on that roof! He’s gonna fall, I wish Frog Boy was here!” and you go BLERRRPH and you go down, you go BLERRRPH and they go “It is! It is him!” and they don’t recognise you when you’re squattin’, they go “Don’t know who you are.”.
And you leap up there, and you come back and they go “Where’s Frog Boy?” and you’re standing up and go “Dunno, he went that way.”
Yeah I’d probably have that one.
You wanna go with Frog Boy.
Right so, er….did that just go out?
Go on, I’ve got a bad head....
Hey, look, Rick, Karl’s really planned this show. He’s, he’s really worked it out....
…he came in early, he was writing things down…
And there’s me just coming up with rubbish like that.
…and you’re just talking rubbish, so Karl, I know you’ve been thinking this through, what’ve you got.
Right, so ‘Educating Ricky’, we did it last week. It’s where I teach you some stuff but, rather than just teach you something I tease ya so you wanna know more, so you wanna take in information.
If only people had taught you like that Karl.
And also it’s the name of a film, sort of, nearly.
Yeah, yeah. Coming up soon, Henry the VIIIth and his…well how many wives? Come back tomorrow Karl to find out!
Well, well, er, the little, the little, er, headlines I’ve got to sort of tease you with the story…
Yeah, this is going to hurt me and I’m not very well, go on.
Don’t,so, so this is what – sorry, I – I’ve just got lost for a minute there.
…and these are the stories that you, these are the things you’re gonna tell him?
But these are just headline versions?
…because then I think people will remember things.
Ah, alright, sort of bullet points.
Indeed, I shall never forget that.
…’Don’t Do That To It, You Know It Can’t Live Without An ‘Ed’
I’ve no idea. It could be about the French Revolution, it could be about anything.
I know what it is! I know what it is. I…eh...
No, you think you do, but…
It, it’s something I taught you! Is it, is it the fact that cockroaches can live nine days without a head?
That’s part of it, but it’s something different as well, that’s why I thought’d be…
Ok, brilliant, so that’s something to look forward to.
So, next one, you won’t work it out. Erm. ‘If Only It Was Raining’.
And the last one, er, ‘What’s Tomato With You?’
He is, you’re, he – you’re obsessed with puns aren’t you at the moment K. You, you, you love them.
It just works, I think it works.
So which of those are you gonna choose, Rick?
Oh, well I’m going to have to choose ‘Don’t Do That, You Know It Can’t Live Without An ‘Ed’.
Ooh can we play a tune and we’ll come back with that?
Wow, what a history lesson that’s gonna be.
Dandy Warhols and ‘Bohemian Like You’ on Xfm 104.9. I’m Ricky Gervais , with me Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington. Karl. What’s the story then.
Right, so what, what did you say you’re going for. You’ve got your three titles, your three teasers.
Well I think I’m gonna go for ‘Don’t Do That To It, You Know It Can’t Live Without An ‘Ed’.
Ooh I’m looking forward to this.
So this is ‘Educating Ricky’ for those who have just tuned in.
Yeah, now, something that Ricky told me about when he was educating me was that a cockroach, if you cut its head off, erm, it lives for a week.
And the only reason it dies is because it can’t take on water.
Sure. It doesn’t have a great time in that week though does it.
I mean it doesn’t get much done I don’t think.
It just…it just needs water and ‘cos it can’t find any without its eyes it eventually dies.
It can’t, no, no that’s not is. It’s ‘cos it can’t drink.
So, with t – have you heard that one about worms?
If you cut a worm in half…
…erm, a lot of people have said in the past that it’ll turn into two worms.
No, it’s a we – it used to be like, you know, er....just said it on…
Yeah, kids at school and stuff you..
So, you know, a lot of people think that.
Don’t pick him up on stuff Steve, it’s bad enough.
So, but what they can do, if you get a worm, right, and you find out which end its head’s at….
…if you, sort of, you’ve got its head there at the left hand side, right, and if you sort of cut it in half…
…but not in half so there’s more of its neck than the tail, if you know what I mean?
The bit you’ve cut off will sort of die, and the rest of the worm will get better, so in a way you can cut it in half and it’ll survive. But only one half will survive.
I wish you hadn’t of chosen that one, Rick, to be honest.
I know, I know! I know, ‘cos it’s not, it’s nothing is it.
You know, you know that joke, um, uh, how d’you tell a worm’s head from it’s ar – eh, put it, put it in a bowl of flour and wait ‘till it farts, right.
I told my mate that, right, and he went “What if it coughs?”
Yeah, so, it is, there is a bit of truth in, in that myth of cutting one in half.
Where did you get this information? I don’t understand where you get this information from.
That was from The Fortean Times It was like the myth, the myth about worms.
The big – that was the big article that week.
Did it take you as long to read that article as it took you to tell us just then?
I like the fact it starts off debunking a myth…
You know the, the big, the big thing about cutting a worm in half and making two worms?
Yeah, what’s the other one, what’s the other headline
I mean it’s not the thing to do either by the way. Don’t, don’t go doing it.
It’s not very nice, it’s cruel.
